item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 9, 2025 at 1:05 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: I built an app to get daily wisdom from Mr. Worldwide (37 points | 15 comments)
2. Presenterm: Markdown Slideshows in the Terminal (70 points | 13 comments)
3. AI tools are spotting errors in research papers (388 points | 141 comments)
4. Maybe coders should learn to love analog? (2024) (30 points | 31 comments)
5. Zig's dot star syntax (value.*) (46 points | 30 comments)
6. "Big 3" science fiction magazines including Asimov's and Analog acquired (64 points | 28 comments)
7. Deploy from local to production (self-hosted) (72 points | 37 comments)
8. Discovering errors in Donald Knuth's TAOCP (114 points | 36 comments)
9. Show HN: Can I run this LLM? (locally) (33 points | 37 comments)
10. Show HN: TypeLeap: LLM Powered Reactive Intent UI/UX (31 points | 11 comments)
11. Social Media Posts About Medical Tests with Potential for Overdiagnosis (13 points | 7 comments)
12. Time for a Change: The long, contentious history of time shifts (15 points | 8 comments)
13. The DOJ still wants Google to sell off Chrome (163 points | 338 comments)
14. OneText (YC W23) is hiring a browser extension engineer ( | hide)
15. Discworld Rules (160 points | 206 comments)
16. Kill your Feeds – Stop letting algorithms dictate what you think (577 points | 224 comments)
17. Toward a Passwordless Future (4 points | discuss)
18. The program is the database is the interface (132 points | 44 comments)
19. MCP vs. API Explained (64 points | 41 comments)
20. Volkswagen reintroducing physical controls for vital functions (255 points | 184 comments)
21. You might not need Redis (145 points | 90 comments)
22. Spark-TTS: Text-2-Speech Model Single-Stream Decoupled Tokens [pdf] (47 points | 1 comment)
23. Long Read: Lessons from Building Semantic Search for GitHub and Why I Failed (101 points | 20 comments)
24. Kagi Is Bringing Orion Web Browser to Linux (254 points | 141 comments)
25. Body Doubling (75 points | 66 comments)
26. Cobalt Networks CobaltOS: Proxmox Port (18 points | 6 comments)
27. Stuff a Pi-hole in your router because your browser is about to betray you (40 points | 19 comments)
28. Ultrasonic deep drawing cuts friction by 20%, extends tool lifespan (79 points | 24 comments)
29. An epic treatise on error models for systems programming languages (190 points | 62 comments)
30. Falkon: A KDE Web Browser (172 points | 94 comments)
